title: Transnational Mathematics Education in the COVID-19 Era: Collaborative Teaching Methods and ICT Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A mathematics application-focused training program for in-service practitioners, emphasizing real-world workplace scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can collaborate with international peers using ICT tools to solve math problems in COVID-19 contexts
Learners can co-construct mathematical knowledge by applying the four stages of the SECI model (socialization, externalization, combination, internalization)
Learners can effectively conduct team projects in large-scale online environments using Zoom breakout rooms and collaborative platforms (e.g., Miro)

resources: Basic Statistical Analysis Tool (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
